Package gov.sandia.gmp.util.numerical.matrix

Class SparseMatrixVector

java.lang.Object
gov.sandia.gmp.util.numerical.matrix.SparseMatrixVector
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class SparseMatrixVector extends Object implements Serializable
Holds a single sparse matrix row or column vector and the indirect index array (row or column) to which the entry belongs. This object is used by the SparseMatrix container in tomography to define a row-ordered, and/or column-ordered, list of vectors that define an entire sparse matrix.

Functionality exists to construct, add, clear, and retrieve the internal data. A trimToSize() function is provided to resize to size() to free memory that is not required. A memoryEstimate() function is provided to estimate the approximate amount of memory used by this SparseMatrixVector. Finally, update functions are provided to multiply the sparse matrix vector by an input vector and return the summed results. Both a double precision and DoubleDouble precision update(...) function is provided.

Author:
jrhipp
See Also:

    • baseMemoryEstimate

      public static long baseMemoryEstimate()

    • setTranspose

      public void setTranspose(int i, ArrayList<SparseMatrixVector> trnsSprs)
      Sets all entries in trnsSprs from this sparse matrix vector which occupies row i in some other sparse matrix definition. The input sparse matrix must have rows defined that encompass the range of values in aIndex. Each entry in aIndex is a row in the input sparse matrix and will have aValue entries copied into them set to index i.
      Parameters:
      i - The row at which this sparse matrix vector is set in some other sparse matrix definition that is used to build the input transpose.
      trnsSprs - A transpose definition from the one within which this sparse matrix vector is the ith row member.

    • normalize

      public void normalize(double[] aColNorm)
      Normalizes each value in aValue by the column entry in aColNorm whose column is selected using the entry in aIndex.
      Parameters:
      aColNorm - The column normalization array.

    • normalizeWithVectorSum

      public double normalizeWithVectorSum()
      Normalizes each value in aValue by the inverse sum of entries in the vector.
      Returns:
      The sum of the entries in the sparse vector before scaling

    • normalizeWithVector1Norm

      public double normalizeWithVector1Norm()
      Normalizes each value in aValue by the sum of the absolute value of the entries in the vector.
      Returns:
      The sum of the absolute value of entries in the sparse vector before scaling.

    • normalizeWithVector2Norm

      public double normalizeWithVector2Norm()
      Normalizes each value in aValue by the inverse square root sum of squares of the entries in the vector.
      Returns:
      The square root sum of squares of entries in the sparse vector before scaling.

    • scale

      public void scale(double scale)
      Scales each value in aValue by the input scale value.
      Parameters:
      scale - The scale factor by which each entry in aValue is scaled

    • update

      public double update(double val, double[] vec)
      Peforms a double precision update of this sparse vector with the input vector vec. The results are summed to the input value (val) and returned on completion.
      Parameters:
      val - The initial value of the returned result.
      vec - The vector that will multiply this sparse vector. This vector is addressed only at locations defined in aIndex.
      Returns:
      The final vector product val += sum(aValue[i] * vec[aIndex[i]]; i = 0; i < aValue.size());

    • update

      public void update(double[] val, double[] vhi, double[] vlo)
      Peforms a DoubleDouble precision update of this sparse vector with the input vector v(hi,lo). The results are summed to the input value (val(hi,lo)) and returned on completion.
      Parameters:
      val - The initial value of the returned result (hi,lo).
      vhi - The DoubleDouble high component of the vector that will multiply this sparse vector. This vector is addressed only at locations defined in aIndex.
      vlo - The DoubleDouble low component of the vector that will multiply this sparse vector. This vector is addressed only at locations defined in aIndex.

      Returns the maximum index stored in aIndex.
      Returns:
      The maximum index stored in aIndex.

      public void writeVector(WritableByteChannel dest, ByteBuffer buffer) throws IOException
      Writes this vector to the specified channel. The channel will need to be flushed via call to NioUtils.flushBufferToChannel() after this call is made to ensure the entire contents of the buffer are written.
      Parameters:
      dest -
      buffer -
      Throws:

    • readVector

      public boolean readVector(ReadableByteChannel src, ByteBuffer buffer) throws IOException
      Throws:
      IOException

    • readVector

      public boolean readVector(FileInputBuffer fib) throws IOException
      Reads a sparse vector definition from the supplied FileInputBuffer (fib) and populates this SparseMatrixVector with the input information. The maximum index (aMaxIndx) is also set. If the index array is ordered in an increasing fashion (aIndex.get(i+1) > aIndex.get(i)) then true is returned to indicate an ordered index array. Otherwise false is returned.
      Parameters:
      fib - The file input buffer from which this sparse matrix vectors information is read.
      Throws:
      IOException

      public double sum()
      Returns the sum-of-squares of all elements int the value array.

      Returns:
      The sum-of-squares of all elements in the value array.

    • sumOfSquaresPartial

      public double sumOfSquaresPartial(int maxVecIndex)
      Returns the sum-of-squares of all elements in the value array whose index is less than the input maximum maxVecIndex.
      Parameters:
      maxVecIndex - The maximum index value for which elements whose index equals or exceeds this value are not included in the result.
      Returns:
      The sum-of-squares of all elements in the value array whose index is less than the input maximum maxVecIndex.

    • buildTransposeSparseMatrix

      public static ArrayList<SparseMatrixVector> buildTransposeSparseMatrix(ArrayList<SparseMatrixVector> inSprs, JProgressBar pb)
      Given the input sparse matrix representation, inSprs, the transpose ordered sparse matrix, trnsSprs, is constructed. That is, if the input sparse matrix is row ordered then the output sparse matrix is column ordered and vice-versa. The transpose is constructed where each row in inSprs becomes a column in trnsSprs and each column in inSprs becomes a row in trnsSprs.

    • multiplyVectors

      public static double multiplyVectors(SparseMatrixVector smv1, SparseMatrixVector smv2)
      Multiplies the two input sparse matrix vectors (smv1 and smv2) together and returns the result to the caller. Only entries in smv1 and smv2 whose index values are equivalent are multiplied and summed to the final result.

      Note that the matrix M = G^T * G can be assembled. The i,j element of M is given by M(i,j) = G^T(i) * G^T(j)

      Parameters:
      smv1 - The first sparse matrix vector to be multiplied by smv2 and returned.
      smv2 - The second sparse matrix vector to be multiplied by smv1 and returned.
      Returns:
      The result of multiplying smv1 * smv2.

    • multiplyPartialVectors

      public static double multiplyPartialVectors(int maxVecIndex, SparseMatrixVector smv1, SparseMatrixVector smv2)
      Multiplies the two input sparse matrix vectors (smv1 and smv2) together and returns the result to the caller. Only entries in smv1 and smv2 whose index values are equivalent are multiplied and summed to the final result. Also, only entries whose index values are less than the input maximum vector index limit, maxVecIndex, are summed.

      Note that the matrix M = G^T * G can be assembled. The i,j element of M is given by M(i,j) = G^T(i) * G^T(j)

      Parameters:
      maxVecIndex - The limiting index for which elements whose index equal or exceed this value are not included in the multiply.
      smv1 - The first sparse matrix vector to be multiplied by smv2 and returned.
      smv2 - The second sparse matrix vector to be multiplied by smv1 and returned.
      Returns:
      The result of multiplying smv1 * smv2.

    • readSparseMatrix

      public static ArrayList<SparseMatrixVector> readSparseMatrix(String fn, JProgressBar pb) throws IOException
      Public static function that reads and returns the sparse matrix from the input file fn.
      Parameters:
      fn - The file from which the sparse matrix will be read.
      Returns:
      The sparse matrix read from file fn.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • writeSparseMatrix

      public static void writeSparseMatrix(String fn, ArrayList<SparseMatrixVector> sprsMtrx, JProgressBar pb) throws IOException
      Writes the input sparse matrix sprsMtrx to the file fn.
      Parameters:
      fn - The file into which sprsMtrx will be written.
      sprsMtrx - The sparse matrix that will be written to file fn.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • getSparseMatrixMaxIndex

      public static int getSparseMatrixMaxIndex(ArrayList<SparseMatrixVector> sprsMtrx)
      Static function that returns the maximum column index from all rows in the input sparse matrix. The maximum row index is simply sprsMtrx.size().
      Parameters:
      sprsMtrx - The input sparse matrix whose maximum column index will be returned.
      Returns:
      The maximum column index represented in sprsMtrx.

    • getSparseMatrixEntries

      public static long getSparseMatrixEntries(ArrayList<SparseMatrixVector> sprsMtrx)
      Static function that returns the total number of entries in the input sparse matrix.
      Parameters:
      sprsMtrx - The input sparse matrix whose total entry count will be returned.
      Returns:
      The total number of entries in the sparse matrix.

    • getMemory

      public static long getMemory(ArrayList<SparseMatrixVector> sprsMtrx)
      Static function that returns the total amount of memory used by the sparse matrix in bytes.
      Parameters:
      sprsMtrx - The input sparse matrix whose total entry count will be returned.
      Returns:
      The total amount of memory used by the sparse matrix in bytes.

    • orderIndexArray

      public static void orderIndexArray(ArrayList<SparseMatrixVector> sprsMtrx, JProgressBar pb)
      Orders the column index array in ascending order if it is found to be out of order.
      Parameters:
      sprsMtrx - The input sparse matrix to be ordered.

    • orderIndexArray

      public static void orderIndexArray(SparseMatrixVector smv)
      Orders the column index array in ascending order if it is found to be out of order (the value array is adjusted accordingly.
      Parameters:
      smv - The input SparseMatrixVector to be ordered.
